title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis promotes New England's culture to attract free agents this offseason.
New England benefits from a successful season with strong recent signings like Stefon Diggs and Harold Landry.
Patriots have significant salary cap space and seek to add key players like Jaelan Phillips in free agency.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams, signed by the Patriots in 2025, delivered 5.5 sacks, aiding their Super Bowl LX run.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million contract, marking the largest in Patriots history with $63 million guaranteed.
His performance places Williams eighth among the top 10 Patriots free-agent signings, noted for his high pass rush win rate.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Celtics are reportedly seeking smaller trades rather than major acquisitions before the NBA trade deadline.
Nets center Nic Claxton is a potential target, valued for his defensive skills and currently earning $25.3 million.
The Celtics have interest in Kings guard Keon Ellis, praised for his shooting and defense, amid high competition for him.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Something in the Way Fest 2026 features indie and alternative rock bands at Boston's Roadrunner venue on Jan. 31 and Feb. 1.
Headliners like Angel Du$t and Tigers Jaw perform, with Tigers Jaw announcing a tour stop at The Sinclair in Cambridge.
Brooklyn-based Momma donates merchandise proceeds to the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota, emphasizing social issues through their performance.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced under a tent at Raymond James Stadium in Florida for Sunday's Stadium Series game.
The tent, measuring 34 feet high, 125 feet wide, and 240 feet long, controls temperature and humidity to protect the ice.
Sunday's game is expected to have cold temperatures, which could improve ice conditions for the outdoor event.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands attended the 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest in Boston Common on January 31, 2026, opposing cooperation with ICE.
Organized by Mass 50501, UU Mass Action, and others, the protest coincided with national actions in over 300 cities.
Participants included activists and community leaders demanding nonviolent resistance and stronger protections for immigrant communities.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people protested Trump's immigration policies in Boston Common amid 15-degree weather following a snowstorm.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and local groups as part of a national movement.
Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band performed on the State House steps, with protesters holding signs and American flags.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox reportedly seeking defensive infield upgrade despite recent offseason moves, potentially targeting Isaac Paredes or Christian Walker.
ESPN insider Jeff Passan suggests Red Sox may trade with Astros or Cubs for infield help before 2026 season.
Possible infield targets include Nico Hoerner and Matt Shaw, though Cubs are unlikely to trade Hoerner, per Passan.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, have unexpectedly reached Super Bowl LX after previous 4-13 seasons.
Drake Maye's standout performance includes leading the league in completion percentage, passing yards per attempt, and passer rating.
Despite postseason struggles, the Patriots defeated the Broncos 10-7 in the AFC title game to face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call Super Bowl LX on NBC alongside Mike Tirico, marking his fourth Patriots game this season.
Collinsworth has covered five Super Bowls involving the Patriots, including their win against the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
Collinsworth praised the Patriots' adaptability, attributing their success to both offensive and defensive strengths this season.
